meanings.sent1: Accidents can disfigure a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti on the wall will disfigure the building.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled paint, and now I disfigure the floor!
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds disfigure the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The scratch will disfigure the car's shiny surface.

meanings.definition: Mar or spoil the attractiveness of (someone)
meanings.sent1: Scars can disfigure a person's face.
meanings.sent2: The mud on his clothes will disfigure his appearance.
meanings.sent3: I joked that the silly hat would disfigure his style.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words disfigure her self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The bad haircut will disfigure his usual charm.
